entry.title: iQoo 13 Malaysia: Snapdragon 8 Elite, 144Hz 2K display and 6,150mAh battery, priced from RM3,499
entry.summary: Malaysia gets another Snapdragon 8 Elite powered smartphone with the arrival of the iQoo 13. Besides rocking a new flagship-class 3nm chip, the iQoo 13 also boasts a large display with a 144Hz refresh rate and a huge 6,150mAh battery. As part of the pre-order promo, iQoo Malaysia is offering freebies worth up to RM1,410. […]
entry.content:
Malaysia gets another Snapdragon 8 Elite powered smartphone with the arrival of the iQoo 13. Besides rocking a new flagship-class 3nm chip, the iQoo 13 also boasts a large display with a 144Hz refresh rate and a huge 6,150mAh battery.

As part of the pre-order promo, iQoo Malaysia is offering freebies worth up to RM1,410.

iQoo 13 Malaysia Price and Pre-order promo

The iQoo 13 comes in two RAM and storage configurations and here’s the official pricing in Malaysia:

  • iQoo 13 12GB + 256GB – RM3,499
  • iQoo 13 16GB + 512GB – RM3,699

If you’re interested, you can order your iQoo 13 from iQoo’s official store on Lazada and Shopee. The device is offered in two colours – Legend (White) and Alpha (Black).

If you pre-order by 6th December 2024, iQoo is offering freebies which include a pair of iQoo TWS 1e earbuds, 2 years of screen crack protection and iQoo 1+2 year warranty.

On top of that, iQoo is also offering an “educational” discount as students and lecturers can enjoy RM300 off. For a limited time, iQoo is also offering iQoo 13 buyers 30% discount for the Vivo Watch 3 and iQoo Finger sleeve for RM9.

iQoo 13 Malaysia specs and features

The iQoo 13 features a 6.82″ 2K (3168×1440 pixels) AMOLED display that supports a variable refresh rate of up to 144Hz and peak brightness of up to 4,500 nits. Under the hood, it runs on Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite that’s paired with up to 16GB of Samsung LPDDR5X Ultra RAM and up to 512GB of UFS 4.1 storage.

In the camera department, the iQoo 13 has a triple rear camera setup featuring a 50MP main camera with a Sony IMX921 1/1.56″ sensor, a 50MP Sony telephoto camera with 2x optical zoom and a 50MP ultra-wide-angle camera.

The flagship smartphone also features a “Floating Light” feature which surrounds the camera bump. The light can flash to provide alerts for calls, messages and charging status.

Over at the front, it features a 32MP selfie camera that sits in a punch-hole on the display. For instant unlocking, there’s also a 3D ultrasonic fingerprint sensor on the screen.

The iQoo 13 also has IP68/IP69 dust and water resistance and dual speakers. The device gets a large 6,150mAh battery that supports 120W Flash Charge. According to iQoo, 1% to 50% charge takes just 14 minutes and a full charge can be done in 30 minutes.

For gamers, you’ll be happy to know that the iQoo 13 also supports bypass charging which allows you to power the phone directly while preventing the battery from overheating. Out of the box, it runs on Android 15 with FunTouch OS 15 skin on top.

entry.title: Honda e:N 1 EV is coming to Malaysia in 2025, Honda’s fully electric “HR-V”
entry.summary: Honda Malaysia will launch its first electric vehicle (EV) in Malaysia very soon and they have confirmed that the Honda e:N 1 will be their first BEV (Battery Electric Vehicle) model. The fully electric SUV is currently being showcased at KLIMS 2024, and this is essentially a fully electrified Honda HR-V. There’s no indicative pricing […]
entry.content:
Honda Malaysia will launch its first electric vehicle (EV) in Malaysia very soon and they have confirmed that the Honda e:N 1 will be their first BEV (Battery Electric Vehicle) model. The fully electric SUV is currently being showcased at KLIMS 2024, and this is essentially a fully electrified Honda HR-V.

There’s no indicative pricing yet and the EV specs of the e:N 1 is quite similar to the BYD Atto 3 in terms of motor and range.

The Honda e:N 1 is a B-segment SUV and for our region, it is currently assembled in Thailand. While it has an exterior that’s identical to the current HR-V, it is built on an e:N Architecture F. The front features MacPherson Strut with Stabiliser Bar while the rear uses Torsion Beam suspension.

In China, the same SUV is offered as a Honda e:NS1 that’s offered by DongFeng Honda and Honda e:NP1 from GAC Honda. Meanwhile, in the UK, it is sold as the Honda e:Ny 1.

Honda e:N 1 key specs and features

The Honda e:N 1 comes with a single motor driving the front axle and it pushes 150kW (201hp) and 310Nm of torque. It comes with a 68.8kWh Lithium Ion battery and it has a NEDC-rated range of up to 500km on a single charge.

According to the UK spec sheet, this fully electric SUV can do 0 to 100km/h in 7.6 seconds up to a top speed of 160km/h. For a more realistic range figure, the EV has a WLTP-rated range of up to 412km on a single charge.

In terms of charging, it comes with a 11kW three phase AC onboard charger and it also supports DC fast charging of up to 77kW. On paper, 10-80% charge via DC takes about 45 minutes while AC takes approximately 6 hours for a full charge.

Similar to the Chery Omoda E5, the CCS2 charging port is located at the front and the cover is released electronically with a push of a button.

For the most part, it looks like your typical Honda HR-V and except for the white “H” logo and the full “Honda” lettering on the boot. The model on display lacks a glass roof and a power tail gate. The EV shown at KLIMS 2024 rides on 225/50 R18 wheels with Continental UltraContact UC6 tyres.

The biggest difference in the interior is a 10.25″ fully digital instrument cluster and a tablet-like 15.1″ touch screen infotainment display which supports Android Auto and Apple Car Play. Unlike your regular HR-V, the e:N 1 also utilises push buttons for its gear selector.

The biggest question is the price. Considering that the current Honda HR-V e:HEV RS hybrid is priced at RM141,900, we are guessing that the Honda e:N 1 could go on sale for about RM160,000 to RM180,000. Would you pay this much for a fully electric Honda SUV with 412km of WLTP range?

entry.title: MG Cyberster now officially in Malaysia for RM320k, comes with 1 year of free charging
entry.summary: First previewed in Malaysia back in August, SAIC Motor is finally ready to unleash the new MG Cyberster in our market. The 2-door fully electric convertible made its public debut in October but its official price tag was only revealed at the KL International Mobility Show (KLIMS) 2024 earlier today. MG Cyberster Malaysia pricing, colourway […]
entry.content:
First previewed in Malaysia back in August, SAIC Motor is finally ready to unleash the new MG Cyberster in our market. The 2-door fully electric convertible made its public debut in October but its official price tag was only revealed at the KL International Mobility Show (KLIMS) 2024 earlier today.

MG Cyberster Malaysia pricing, colourway

In Malaysia, the MG Cyberster can only be obtained in one variant which has a dual motor all-wheel drive (AWD) setup. Price-wise, the MG Cyberster is available in Malaysia for RM319,900.

In terms of exterior colourways, the Cyberster can obtain in four options including Dynamic Red, Camden Grey, Inca Yellow, and English White. As for interior colours, it depends on the exterior colour that you choose as the Dynamic Red and Camden Grey options come with black and red interiors.

On the other hand, Inca Yellow and English White versions have grey interiors. Regardless of the exterior and interior that you preferred, all Cyberster in Malaysia features a black hood.

MG Cyberster Malaysia warranty, launch offer

The Cyberster has a 7-year / 150,000km vehicle warranty and an 8-year / 180,000km warranty specifically for its high-voltage battery. The EV’s mileage drive motor and motor control unit are also covered by an 8-year / 160,000km warranty.

In conjunction with the launch, MG Cyberster customers will be provided with 1 year of free charging at JomCharge chargers. They will also receive access to the charging network’s AutoCharge feature which was previously only available to selected EVs such as Chery Omoda E5 and GAC Aion Y Plus.

MG Cyberster Malaysia quick specs

As noted earlier, there is only one variant of MG Cyberster in Malaysia which features a dual motor all-wheel drive setup that provides a total power output of 375kW (503hp) and 725Nm of torque. Powered by a 77 kWh battery, it can go from 0 to 100 km/h in just 3.2 seconds and can deliver a WLTP-rated range of 446 km.

The Cyberster released in Malaysia is fitted with just a 7kW single-phase AC onboard charger and it takes around 10.5 hours to get the EV to go from 10% to 100% via AC charging. As for DC charging, the EV can support charging speed of up to 150kW which allows its battery to be charged from 10% to 80% in 38 minutes.

Alongside its signature scissor doors, the Cyberster is also equipped with plenty of screens including the 7-inch central touchscreen display, a 10.25-inch driver display, and two 7-inch auxiliary screens on either side. Furthermore, the EV comes standard with an 8-speaker Bose audio system alongside Alcantara-based sports seats and a steering wheel covered in Nappa leather.

Safety-wise, the electric roadster relies on the Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) suite called MG Pilot. The suite has a long list of features including Front Collision Warning (FCW), Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB), Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC), and Traffic Jam Assistance (TJA).

The ADAS suite also offers Lane Departure Warning (LDW), Lane Keeping Assistance (LKA), Blind Spot Detection (BSD), Lane Change Assist (LCA), Rear Cross Traffic Alert (RCTA) and Intelligent High Beam Assist. Cyberster has also been fitted with 4 airbags, a 360-degree camera and Brembo front brakes.

entry.title: GAC Aion ES: Malaysia’s cheapest EV sedan, priced at RM106.8K
entry.summary: [ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing. === WTC Automotif (M) Sdn Bhd (WTCA), a subsidiary of Warisan TC Holdings Bhd, has […]
entry.content:
[ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing.

===

WTC Automotif (M) Sdn Bhd (WTCA), a subsidiary of Warisan TC Holdings Bhd, has officially launched the GAC Aion ES. This is currently Malaysia’s cheapest fully electric sedan and it’s priced just above RM100,000.

Unlike current sub-RM180,000 EV sedan contenders like the GWM Ora 07 and the BYD Seal, the Aion ES has quite a barebones offering. If you’ve visited Thailand, you might have spotted the Aion ES being utilised for taxi fleets.

GAC Aion ES Malaysia Pricing

The 2025 Aion ES comes in a single variant and it is officially priced at RM106,800 in Malaysia. According to WTCA, the fully imported EV sedan comes with a comprehensive warranty and after-sales package which includes 8-year/160,000km base vehicle warranty and 8-year/200,000km EV battery, drive motor and electric control warranty.

As part of its launch promo, buyers of the Aion ES in Malaysia will receive a complementary 7kW AC Home wallbox charger worth RM3,500.

The Aion ES is offered in three colours – Glamour Black, Holographic Silver and Pure White.

This model is the second GAC EV to launch in Malaysia after the Aion Y Plus. According to WTCA, they will introduce an attractive and comprehensive inventory of GAC and GAC Aion models over the next five years which include internal combustion engine (ICE), hybrid and EV models.

GAC Aion ES Malaysia Specs and Key Features

The Aion ES comes with a single motor driving the front wheels that pushes 100kW (134hp) and 225Nm of torque. According to the Thai product page, the Aeon ES has a 0-100km/h time of 12.1 seconds and a top-speed of 150km/h.

The EV sedan utilises Aion’s AEP 2.0 platform which is shared with the Aion Y Plus mini-MPV. It gets Macpherson suspension for the front and Torsion Beam suspension for the rear.

Powering up this EV is a 55.2kWh LFP Magazine battery which has an NEDC-rated range of 442km on a single charge or 364km on the stricter WLTP cycle. For charging, it comes with a single-phase 6.6kW AC on-board charger and it supports DC fast charging up to 60kW.

According to the spec-sheet, it takes 11 hours for a full charge on AC charging while DC fast charging takes 30 minutes to get from 30-80%. The Aeon ES also supports Vehicle-to-Load (V2L) to power up your home appliances with a maximum power output of 3.3kW.

On the inside, the sedan features a traditional instrument cluster with a 3.5″ LCD screen and an 8″ touch screen display which supports Apple CarPlay. The Aeon ES has keyless start, dual-zone automatic climate control, rear aircon vents, PM2.5 filter, wide angle rear view camera and cruise control system.

Also included as standard are front SRS airbags, electronic parking brake (EPB) with autohold function, hill hold control, Anti-lock braking system (ABS), electronic brakeforce distribution (EBD), electronic stability program (ESP) and hydraulic brake assist (HBA).

In terms of dimensions, the Aeon ES is 4,810mm long, 1,880mm wide, 1,545mm tall and has a wheelbase of 2,750mm. Overall, this 5-seater sedan weighs 1,665kg and it has a boot capacity of 450 litres.

This sedan rides on 17″ 215/55 R17 wheels and like the Aion Y Plus, it also comes with a full-size spare tyre.

You can check out the full spec sheet below:

entry.title: Perodua eMO-II EV Concept revealed. Production EV to be priced under RM90K
entry.summary: [ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing. === National carmaker Perodua has just unveiled its eMO-II. This is their latest EV concept […]
entry.content:
[ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing.

===

National carmaker Perodua has just unveiled its eMO-II. This is their latest EV concept which is expected to be the Electric Myvi for the masses.

The concept vehicle was unveiled during Kuala Lumpur International Mobility Show (KLIMS) 2024 and the car features a more futuristic design than the earlier Perodua eMO-I concept.

There isn’t much details yet but Perodua revealed that the upcoming EV is targeted to be priced under RM90,000. The hatchback EV boasts about 400km of range and it is equipped with a CATL-sourced LFP battery with about 50kWh of capacity.

In terms of charging, a full charge on AC takes about 8 hours, while DC charging from 30-80% is expected to take about 30 minutes.

Interestingly, Perodua aims to have a 0-100km/h acceleration time of less than 7 seconds for this electric hatchback.

In terms of availability, Perodua expects to launch its first EV sometime in 2025. The carmaker is targeting a production volume of 500 per month in the initial phase.

When asked about the possibility about battery swapping, Perodua said they can’t reveal at the moment but it is in their study, soon.

When it comes to national EV, its direct local rival Proton is expected to launch the Proton e.MAS 7 in the coming weeks. Unlike the eMO-II, the e.MAS7 is a mid-sized fully electric SUV and it is expected to be priced from RM120,000. The first batch of Proton e.MAS 7 EVs will be fully imported from China.

Enjoy live photos of the interior below along with official press photos from Perodua:

Perodua eMO-II Concept Interior Live Photo Gallery

Perodua eMO-II Concept Exterior Gallery

Perodua eMO-II Concept Interior Gallery

entry.title: Nissan Kicks e-Power Malaysia: EV with “genset”, up to 900km range, priced from RM113.8K
entry.summary: [ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing. === Edaran Tan Chong Motor (ETCM) has officially launched the Nissan Kicks e-Power in Malaysia. […]
entry.content:
[ EV User Training ] Thinking of switching to an EV? Join our EV User Training to learn how to maximise your EV experience and beat range anxiety on Sunday, 8th December 2024. Register now to enjoy early bird pricing.

===

Edaran Tan Chong Motor (ETCM) has officially launched the Nissan Kicks e-Power in Malaysia. This is a hybrid vehicle that is essentially an EV with a petrol engine as a genset.

As teased earlier, the Nissan Kicks e-Power is priced well under RM130,000 and they have been accepting bookings since last month.

Nissan Kicks e-Power Malaysia Pricing

The Nissan Kicks e-Power comes in two variants including a two-tone option for the higher-spec VLT version. Here’s the official pricing in Malaysia:

  • Nissan Kicks e-Power VL – RM113,800
  • Nissan Kicks e-Power VLT – RM121,800
  • Nissan Kicks e-Power VLT (2-tone) – RM125,800

The Nissan Kicks e-Power comes with a 5-year/100,000km warranty and 8-year/160,000km warranty for the EV components which include the Lithium-Ion battery, inverter, motor and e-Power Control Unit.

As part of the introductory offer, ETCM is offering a RM5,000 rebate and a 10-year EV components warranty for the first 500 customers of the Nissan Kicks e-Power. Deliveries are expected to begin in early 2025.

Nissan Kicks e-Power Key Specs and Features

The Nissan Kicks e-Power features a 1.2L 3-cylinder generator petrol engine and an electric motor that pushes 95kW (127hp) and 280Nm, and to charge the 2.06kWh Lithium-Ion battery. This compact SUV boasts a 0-100km/h acceleration of 9.5 seconds, up to a top-speed of 180km/h.

The Nissan Kicks e-Power is said to be capable of delivering an impressive fuel efficiency of 21.7km per litre (based on NEDC cycle). It is claimed to offer a driving range of up to 900km from its 41-litre fuel tank.

Unlike conventional hybrids, the Nissan Kicks e-Power provides the closest driving experience to an electric vehicle. The SUV is 100% driven by the electric motor which provides instant torque and it also has e-Pedal which provides a one-pedal driving experience.

According to ETCM, the e-Power system offers 20% lower tailpipe emissions and lower running costs compared to internal combustion engine powered vehicles. It is said that an average service costs RM365.

Both Nissan Kicks e-Power variants will come with 7 airbags, Vehicle Dynamic Control (VDC), Traction Control System (TCS), Hill Start Assist (HSA), Intelligent Driver Alertness (IDA) and Cruise Control.

Also included as standard are 8″ infotainment screen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, 6-speakers and 3x USB ports.

The range-topping VLT adds exra driver assistance and safety features such as intelligent around view monitor (360-degree camera) with Intelligent Moving Object Detection, Intelligent rear view mirror, intelligent cruise control, blind spot warning and rear cross traffic alert. The dual-tone leather Zero Gravity seats and the option for dual-tone exterior body colour are offered for an extra RM4,000. .

entry.title: Aeon Bank Debit Card users can enjoy 4x Aeon Points on Thursdays. Here’s how
entry.summary: If you want to stretch your ringgit further, Aeon Bank and Aeon Co are jointly running a “Thursday is better than Friday” campaign where you can earn 4x Aeon Points. The offer is applicable when you shop at selected Aeon outlets every Thursday using your Aeon Bank Debit Card. The participating stores include Aeon Supermarket, […]
entry.content:
If you want to stretch your ringgit further, Aeon Bank and Aeon Co are jointly running a “Thursday is better than Friday” campaign where you can earn 4x Aeon Points. The offer is applicable when you shop at selected Aeon outlets every Thursday using your Aeon Bank Debit Card.

The participating stores include Aeon Supermarket, Aeon Departmental Store, Aeon MaxValu Prime, Aeon Big Hypermarket, Aeon Wellness and Daiso by Aeon.

Aeon Bank Debit Card offers 3x Aeon Points for every RM1 spent at Aeon stores on Thursdays

From 7th November until 26th December 2024, Aeon Bank Visa Debit Card-i customers will earn 3x Aeon Points for every RM1 spent at selected Aeon outlets on Thursdays. For other days of the week (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday), customers will earn 2x Aeon Points for every RM1 spent at selected Aeon outlets.

Earn extra 1x Aeon Point by showing your Aeon Points barcode

Besides the Debit Card transaction, you can still earn an additional 1x Aeon Points for every RM1 spent by showing your Aeon Points barcode at the cashier or at the self checkout kiosks. You can find the barcode on the home screen of the Aeon Bank app and then swipe the top panel to the left. In total, that’s 4x Aeon Points that you can earn for every RM1 spent at selected Aeon outlets on Thursdays.

For other transactions outside of Aeon, you can still earn 1x Aeon Points for every RM1 spent at participating merchants and retail outlets both in-store or online using your Aeon Bank Debit Card.

To learn more, you can check out the campaign T&C or visit their promo page for more details.

How to convert Aeon Points into cash in Aeon Bank app?

Once you’ve accumulated your Aeon Points, you can convert them to cash instantly via the Aeon Bank App. Just tap on the “Rewards” button on the home screen, and then tap on Redeem Now.

The minimum points for redemption is 200 points, which is equivalent to RM1. So, if you have 10,000 points, that’s worth RM50, while 100,000 points is worth RM500.

In case you missed it, Aeon Bank currently offers a profit rate of 0.88% p.a. for Savings Account and a profit rate of 3.00% p.a. for Savings Pots until 31st December 2024.

In addition, the Islamic digital bank is also waiving its 1% service fee for overseas transactions, and a RM5 processing fee discount (Usual Fee: RM10) for ATM withdrawals overseas.

Aeon Bank is still running a referral programme where Aeon Bank users can earn 1,800 Aeon Points (worth RM9) for successful referrals.

entry.title: Here’s how CIMB’s first Visa Debit Card aims to help children diagnosed with Cerebral Palsy
entry.summary: This post is brought to you by CIMB. In a groundbreaking initiative, CIMB Bank Berhad and CIMB Islamic Bank Berhad have introduced Malaysia’s first Visa debit card dedicated to supporting children with cerebral palsy. The launch, held at CIMB’s Plaza Damansara branch, signifies the bank’s commitment to creating a more inclusive society while championing impactful […]
entry.content:
This post is brought to you by CIMB.

In a groundbreaking initiative, CIMB Bank Berhad and CIMB Islamic Bank Berhad have introduced Malaysia’s first Visa debit card dedicated to supporting children with cerebral palsy. The launch, held at CIMB’s Plaza Damansara branch, signifies the bank’s commitment to creating a more inclusive society while championing impactful social causes.

The launch event featured esteemed guests, including YB Hannah Yeoh, Minister of Youth and Sports, who officiated the event alongside key representatives from CIMB and Gabungan Anak-Anak Palsi Serebrum (GAPS).

“This initiative not only raises awareness about cerebral palsy but also inspires collective action towards building a more compassionate society,” said YB Hannah Yeoh. Paralympic athlete Mohammad Ridzuan Mohamad Puzi also joined the event, adding inspiration to the occasion.

Understanding Cerebral Palsy

Cerebral palsy, a neurological condition caused by brain damage during or after birth, affects movement, posture, and motor skills. Families caring for children with cerebral palsy face significant challenges, particularly those from the B40 income group. These challenges include the cost of specialized healthcare, education, and rehabilitation equipment.

Rafidah Rafizah Ahmad, President and Founder of GAPS, emphasized the critical role of support systems by saying, “More than 81% of families caring for children with cerebral palsy are in the B40 group. CIMB’s support through this initiative will help alleviate financial burdens and empower these children to reach their full potential.”

The CIMB Visa Debit Card: A Card with a Purpose

At the heart of this initiative is the new CIMB Visa debit card which is designed for a good cause. For every card issued, CIMB will contribute RM2 to GAPS, providing sustainable funding for rehabilitation equipment and enrichment programs for children with cerebral palsy.

The card also highlights CIMB’s commitment to sustainability by being made from recycled PVC materials. This eco-conscious choice reflects the bank’s broader goals of minimizing environmental impact through sustainable product design.

“Our mission is to drive financial growth while supporting meaningful social causes. This partnership with GAPS reinforces our belief that change begins at the community level,” said Effendy Shahul Hamid, CEO of CIMB Group Consumer and Digital Banking.

CIMB Community Hub: A Space for Collaboration

As part of the launch, CIMB unveiled its first Community Hub at Plaza Damansara. Designed as a collaborative space, the hub brings together NGOs, customers, and communities to address urgent social needs.

Effendy added, “The Community Hub allows us to deepen our engagement with the public, fostering sustainable solutions that empower underserved groups.” The hub serves as a model for future expansions, inspiring Malaysians to come together and actively support community-driven initiatives.

Get your CIMB Visa Debit Card Today

The CIMB Visa debit card is now available at branches nationwide. By signing up, Malaysians can join a movement that supports children with cerebral palsy while contributing to a sustainable and inclusive future.

Learn more about the CIMB Visa debit card and the Community Hub today.

entry.title: AirAsia offers fixed fares to Sabah and Sarawak for CNY 2025, all-in one-way fares from RM328
entry.summary: Planning to fly home to Sabah and Sarawak this coming Chinese New Year? AirAsia has kicked off its fixed fares promo for the upcoming festive season where you can book an all-in one-way fare to East Malaysia from RM328. The upcoming Chinese New Year falls on 29th January 2025 and if you haven’t book your […]
entry.content:
Planning to fly home to Sabah and Sarawak this coming Chinese New Year? AirAsia has kicked off its fixed fares promo for the upcoming festive season where you can book an all-in one-way fare to East Malaysia from RM328.

The upcoming Chinese New Year falls on 29th January 2025 and if you haven’t book your tickets yet, this might be a deal worth checking out.

Fly to Sarawak for RM328, to Sabah for RM388 this coming Chinese New Year

The fixed fare promo offers all-in one-way fares of just RM328 for flights between Kuala Lumpur to Kuching, Sibu, Bintulu and Miri, as well as Johor Bahru to Kuching Sibu, Bintulu and Miri.

Meanwhile for those heading to Sabah, AirAsia offers all-in one-way fares of just RM388 for flights from Kuala Lumpur to Kota Kinabalu, Sandakan and Tawau, and Johor Bahru to Kota Kinabalu and Tawau.

Take note that the fixed fare promo is only valid for selected flights as listed above (one flight per sector) which are mostly scheduled close or around midnight. The all-in fares include passenger service charge, regulatory service charges, fuel surcharge and other fees. However, it excludes other options such as checked-in luggage allowance, seat selection, meals and more.

The booking period for the promo is from today (3rd December 2024) until 4th February 2025, for the travel period of 24th January to 4th February 2025.

According to AirAsia, they are operating almost 3,600 flights weekly during the 2025 festive season with over 27,000 feats available at fixed prices.

RM499 base fare cap for flights four days before Christmas

In addition, AirAsia is also supporting the government’s initiative of setting a ceiling price of RM499 for one-way economy class flights for flights from Peninsular Malaysia to East Malaysia during the year-end holiday season. The base fare for selected flights will be offered at a maximum of RM499 applicable for flights four days before Christmas Day (25th December 2024).

Commenting on the campaign, Transport Minister Anthony Loke said, “The government remains committed to helping people reunite during festive periods. It is encouraging to see AirAsia leading efforts to make travel more affordable and accessible. This aligns with our ongoing initiatives, including the RM499** ceiling fare subsidy and the FLYsiswa programme to ease student financial burden to travel between Peninsular and East Malaysia. We look forward to collaborating with other industry partners on this initiative for the betterment of our nation.”

AirAsia is also advising all travellers to self check-in online via AirAsia.com or the AirAsia Move app, up to 14 days prior to the departure date and to use the eBoarding pass for a seamless travel experience. During the festive season, passengers are advised to arrive early at the airport and the baggage drop counters are open three hours before departure for international flights, and two hours before departure for domestic flights within Malaysia.

[ SOURCE ]

entry.title: Honda to go all out at KLIMS 2024: eVTOL flying car, Motocompacto electric scooter, Prelude Concept
entry.summary: Honda is one of the big names that will be participating at the KL International Motor Show (KLIMS) 2024 which is set to take place from 5 to 11 December at MITEC. Aside from its extensive vehicle lineup from City to CR-V, the Japanese giant will also showcase several special vehicles during the event. Honda […]
entry.content:
Honda is one of the big names that will be participating at the KL International Motor Show (KLIMS) 2024 which is set to take place from 5 to 11 December at MITEC. Aside from its extensive vehicle lineup from City to CR-V, the Japanese giant will also showcase several special vehicles during the event.

Honda eVTOL: The brand’s “flying car”

One of the models that Honda will showcase at KLIMS 2024 is not exactly a car. Instead, it will be a “flying car” called Honda eVTOL.

Do manage your expectations though: the unit that will be displayed at KLIMS 2025 is a scale model. Originally announced in 2021, the Honda eVTOL aimed to make air transportation “easier and more casual,”.

For this project, the company is generally using all the knowledge that it has learned from developing the HondaJet and various hybrid technologies including the Formula 1 power unit. It has also incorporated elements from the Honda Sensing driver assistance system into the eVTOL project.

The eVTOL name stands for electric vertical take-off and landing which pretty much explained the nature of the aircraft. That being said, Honda is planning to use a hybrid power unit for the aircraft which would allow it to travel up to 400km.

The power unit would enable the Honda eVTOL to become an intercity transportation vehicle. This is as opposed to a fully electric power unit would reduce the aircraft’s range to around 100km.

Equipped with 8 rotors for take-off alongside 2 more rotors for propulsion, the exact status of the Honda eVTOL project is still unclear. However, it has been reported that the Honda Research Institute in California has received the green light from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration to fly a test vehicle for the next two years.

Honda Motocompacto: A modern take on the Motocompo

Deemed as the successor to the Motocompo, Honda Motocompacto was first revealed to the world in late 2023. Unlike its 1980 counterpart which was fitted with a 50cc engine, the modern version features a 490W (0.7hp) electric motor that also produces 16Nm of torque.

Powered by a 6.8Ah battery, the foldable electric scooter can deliver up to 19km of range and has a top speed of 24km/h. Honda claimed that it takes around 3.5 hours to charge the Motocompacto.

Honda Malaysia did not provide many details in its KLIMS 2024’s announcements although it did say that visitors are able to “experience” the Motocompacto during the event. With that, we believe that you can take a ride with the highly compact electric scooter which is being sold in the U.S. for USD995 (~RM4,445).

Honda Prelude Concept: The return of a legend

The original Honda Prelude was released back in 1978 but it was “retired” in 2001. Fast forward to 22 years later, Honda decided that it was the best time to bring back the Prelude name into the market although the production model is expected to be released sometime in 2025 or 2026.

However, the company has yet to release any in-depth information regarding the sports coupe even though the sleek-looking concept model seems fit for production. The only thing that Honda has revealed to the world that the new Prelude will feature a hybrid powertrain.

Honda Malaysia said that this is the first time that the Prelude Concept is being displayed in Asia outside of Japan. On a related note, we also have been hearing rumours that the e:N1 EV might be shown at KLIMS 2024 too but this has not yet been confirmed by Honda Malaysia so far.
